caption: Not too vast not too small. Interesting, particularly as a designer. The guided visit of the exhibition on the top floor was standout in knitting in to my understanding of Parisian/French history. And the history and development of ceramics.
Very nice museum of ceramics through the ages and genres. There is a little bit for everyone. Parking was a challenge because of a music festival next door but that shouldn't last.
Fantastic collection, building desperately in need of renovation & a contemporary layout.
Very extensive collection of ceramics and porcelain, from ancient to modern, and from different parts of the world. Many pieces are impressive in size and detail!!!
This was way better than I expected. So many fun and surprising pieces. Strongly recommended. Expect to spend a few hours if you want to take everything in.
Wonderful collection of antique porcelain. Wish they had more translations. Wherever you could read English was more interesting to tourists.

DO NOT GO!!!  Despite being fully vaccinated, with my valid double vaccination CDC card from the USA, the horribly “bureaucratic” staff — except 1 out of half a dozen: 1 professional, even if unable to “help”, others unimaginably unprofessional, and rude — both the website and in person “provide” miscommunication, and lack of information to the visiting public, about requirements to enter: only French QR “pass sanitaire” ‘accepted’ (unable to obtain ahead of time, despite having requested information from the embassy many weeks ago, before traveling to France, nor here in person, also due to a lack of larger clearer and understandable governmental guidelines, once HERE, as to where/how to obtain one; and/or ridiculous to imagine that each and every place would require a new PCR test every 72 hours!!!). NO OTHER PLACE IN FRANCE, PARIS IN PARTICULAR, CREATED THIS PROBLEM, and no other museum, exhibition, or restaurant, either public, or private space, required this in over a month here in France. UTTERLY UNACCEPTABLE!  Update after two weeks: REFUND for paid tickets still not received!!! Equally UNACCEPTABLE!!!  UPDATE 2: The "reply" received, does not address the rudeness and lack of professionalism and lack of accurate information on half a dozen (yes, 6!) employees at the Museum... AND, a REFUND from the museum still has not been issued. The standard "refer[ing] to the law" response lacks the appropriate reply regarding the above (unprofessional and rude attitudes of the staff, minus one who was professional and sympathetic towards the issues at hand). THE QR CODE requirement is NOT (at the time we checked) mentioned as being the ONLY ACCEPTABLE means to access the museum. AND, effectively, THIS MUSEUM is accusing ALL THE OTHER FRENCH INSTITUTIONS we had visited during one whole month as 'breaking the law" per their response! I had a VALID COVID VACCINATION CARD from USA, ACCEPTED EVERYWHERE ELSE IN FRANCE!
Fascinating and massive collection of ceramic sculptures and art, quiet place to spend the day. Very near from the T2 tram station
Definitely worth a visit. You have from Majolica to Meissen...for all the connoisseurs out there! The Sevres collection and legacy is impressive!
recommended museaum. free entry on first sunday of every month
Extraordinary experience for kids. Really gems in this museum giving a new perspective on human history.
I work at the ancient site of the manufacture royale de Sèvres. It was a wonderful time visiting la manufacture royale.
One of the best ceramic museums! Well worth the visit.

It's a part of French history.  The most beautiful masterpiece of cups, plates and vases were created here for the richest people in the world.  Also they have an unbelievable huge collection of porcelain from all parts of the earth. However, there is a lot of dust on the glass shelves. It would be better if they cleaned a bit. Some examples need to be ranged, there are some mistakes in numbers and the information to describe the items.
Very varied collection of ceramics. Special exhibition "The Experience of Colour" was particularly good.
Very nice museum, easy way to access the tram and buses. Stay beside the park Saint cloud. Worth a visit for people interested in ceramic items

A beautiful museum on the outskirts of Paris. They have beautiful porcelaine pieces as well as other masterpieces. You'd need more than 2 hours to properly visit it. On the first floor, they explain how the porcelaine is made in this atelier

I give it a 5 stars because most of the people I met and are working there are nice. Many pieces of ceramics and some glass pieces too, the museum is abobe average when it comes to the quality, age and number of the art pieces, especially when comparing to Louvre as an example or other eputable ceramics museums across Europe, there are some very nice pieces here but the collection is a bit limited however in comparison with other specific museums, very close however. Do not understand the above wrong the collection is huge and has many nice pieces just that there are a couple of other European museums that top this one. If you profit on the free entrance for the 1st Sunday of the month than it is a great choice especially if you have a walk on the Domaine Saint Cloud after!

Unique place, stunning architecture. The security is calm, very polite and professional in the same time. The visit was well worth the 8€. Meanwhile, the discriminatory security at Musee de la liberation can make you vomit.

Amazing ceramics collection raging from the ancient times to modernity. Was pleasantly surprised to see pieces from the far east. All sections have extensive descriptions on techniques used and function of the pieces. Great place to visit for anyone interested in pottery

A good place to go: the exposition and the history of ceramic. Great things to see and learn. With kids easy going museum and after you can strech your legs in the Parc and your kids have some free air and running.  Easy access from downtown Paris via Metro 9 or T2
This museum has an excellent display of ceramics, although their collection is so much larger than only the pieces on display.
A small museum just outside Paris. Great value for money and no queues. Afterwards have a walk along the Seine and the surrounding parks
The website offers 3 sorts of visits but we were only offered the exhibiting on arrival.   Howe the exhibits were most impressive.
Fantastic experience. Lots of information. I did the two hour tour. Definitely recommend.

Interesting display of artifacts with a short summary of the manufacturing process not so easy to apprehend without support. Unfortunately the numerous staff seems too deeply bored only looking forward to the closure for the day.
Really nice museum. Very nice installations and exhibitions. Lots of historical dishes. Really loved it. Highly recommend it.
A hidden gem. Very few people outside the local area know of this living museum that is still physically coupled with a working ceramic factory that can claim over 200 years of history.
Stunning collection. Would have liked to see more Sevres pieces; but current production  is sold to discerning customers worldwide; historical pieces are scattered in palaces throughout Europe 🤗 …
It is really good for arts lovers... there are a lot of ceramic arts available.
this is such a beautiful space a adorable for every tourist and should be a better experience for everyone
Would be nice to have a chance to get the information in English, while listening the guide.
Beautiful porcelain worth the trip.  Friendly and helpful staff even with language barrier.
The ceramic collection is outstanding..art nouveau masterpieces 💞💞💞 …
Nice and helpful staff at the archives
Interesting museum with good temporary expos
super
